name: channel.mention
longDescription: Returns a string with a channel mention.
shortDescription: Get the #mention for the channel

name: channel.id
longDescription: Returns the ID of a channel.
shortDescription: Get the id of the channel

name: channel.type
longDescription: Returns an integer for the [channel type](https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#channel-object-channel-types).
shortDescription: Get the type of the channel.

name: channel.createdAt
longDescription: Returns a [timestamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date#description) for the creation date of a channel that can be used with [{time}](https://documentation.atlas.bot/en/scripts/tags/global#time-formattime).
shortDescription: Get the time that this channel was created at.

name: channel.nsfw
shortDescription: Check whether this channel contains explicit content.

name: channel.name
longDescription: Returns the name of a channel.
shortDescription: Get the name of the channel

name: channel.lastMessageId
longDescription: Returns the ID of the last message sent in a channel.
shortDescription: Get the last message sent in a channel.

name: channel.topic
longDescription: Returns a channel topic, also known as channel description.

name: channel.parentId
longDescription:
Get the parent ID of the channel. For regular channels this is the category ID. For threads this is the ID of the parent channel.

```pella
{channel.parentId} // "", a channel with no parent
{channel.parentId} // "532902705404837888", a regular channel with a parent
{channel.parentId} // "532902728834351115", a thread channel with a parent
```
shortDescription: Get the parent of a channel.

name: channel.isThread
shortDescription: Determine whether the channel is a thread

name: channel.isVoice
shortDescription: Determine whether the channel is a voice channel

name: channel.isTextable
shortDescription: Determine whether a channel can accept text messages

name: channel.edit
signature: {channel.edit name? topic? nsfw? archived? ratelimit? parent?;channel}
longDescription:
Updates a channel.

#### Arguments

*   `name`: The new name of the channel.
*   `topic`: The new topic of the channel.
*   `nsfw`: Whether the channel is NSFW or not.
*   `archived`: Whether this channel is archived; channel must be a thread.
*   `ratelimit`: How often users can send messages in this channel, for example `1m`.
*   `parent`: The category to move the channel to.
shortDescription: Edit the options for a channel

name: channel.startThread
signature: {channel.startThread auto_archive_duration? ratelimit? invitable? is_private? return_id? channel?;name;message?}
longDescription:
Creates a new thread.

*   `name` the name of the thread.
*   `message` the message the thread is created from.
*   `auto_archive_duration` the time until threads are archived after inactivity. Can be `one_hour`, `one_day`, `three_days` or `one_week`.
*   `ratelimit` how often users can send messages in the thread, for example `1m`.
*   `invitable` whether non-moderators can add other non-moderators to the thread; only available on private threads.
*   `is_private` whether the read is private, must not have a message to be private.
*   `return_id` whether to return the ID of the created thread.
*   `channel` the channel to create the thread on.
shortDescription: Create a new thread channel

name: channel.create
signature: {channel.create name type topic nsfw parent return_id;channel}
longDescription:
Creates a new channel.

#### Arguments

*   `name`: The name of the channel.
*   `type`: The [type](https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#channel-object-channel-types) of the channel. `guildtext`, `guild_text`, `GUILD_TEXT`, and `GuildText` are all valid and will all resolve to a guild text channel. IDs are also supported but the name is preferred.
*   `topic`: The topic of the channel.
*   `nsfw`: Whether the channel is NSFW or not.
*   `parent`: The parent channel, if any.
*   `return_id`: Whether to return the created channels ID or not.
shortDescription: Create a new channel

name: channel.delete
longDescription:
> This tag can do serious damage if you are not extremely careful with validating inputs. {.is-warning}

Deletes a channel.
shortDescription: Delete a channel

name: emoji.id
longDescription: The ID of the emoji. For guild emojis, this is the emoji snowflake. For native emojis this is the native emoji character.
shortDescription: Gets the guild emoji ID or native emoji character

name: emoji.markdown
longDescription: Get the emoji formatted for a Discord message. This will return the custom guild emoji format for guild emojis and the native emoji character for native emojis.
shortDescription: Formats the emoji for Discord

name: emoji.name
shortDescription: Gets the name of an emoji

name: emoji.url
longDescription: The URL to the emoji. For guild emojis, this is the .gif or .png link. For native emojis, this is a .png link to the twemoji image.
shortDescription: Gets the url of an emoji

name: emoji.animated
longDescription: Whether the emoji is animated. False for native emojis.
shortDescription: Gets whether an emoji is animated

name: emoji.category
longDescription: Get the category of an emoji. For native emojis this matches the lowercase name of categories from the emoji picker in Discord, for example `people` or `objects`. For guild emojis this will be `guild`.
shortDescription: Gets the category of an emoji

name: emoji.aliases
longDescription: Get the aliases for an emoji. Native emojis only.
shortDescription: Gets the aliases of an emoji

name: option
longDescription: Get the value of a defined option. For this example, we'll assume the user ran the command as `/inspect input:example text user:@Sylver#1058` {option;input} // "example text" {option;user} // "111372124383428608" {user.username;{option;user}} // "Sylver" And for this example, we'll assume the user ran the command as `/inspect input:example text` {option;input} // "example text" {option;user} // "", because the user didn't provide a user option
shortDescription: Get an interaction option

name: time
longDescription:
Formats time as a string. Is compatible with any of the `.createdAt` tags.

#### Arguments

*   `time` Can be any time that the bot can parse. This includes millisecond timestamps `1644856250309`, unix timestamps `1644856250`, relative times `5 hours`, ISO timestamps `2022-02-14T16:31:26.725Z` and many others. Defaults to the current time.
*   `format` Can be a [timestamp style](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#message-formatting-timestamp-styles) - names or descriptions both work. If no style is provided, unix timestamp is returned. This should only be used when outputting time to users as it returns the time formatted with Discord's timestamp markdown.
*   `to` The Luxon format to use. Incompatible with `format`. See [Luxon's documentation](https://moment.github.io/luxon/docs/manual/formatting.html#table-of-tokens) for a list of all available formats.

```pella
{time}  // 1636084903
{time format=relative_time;5 hours ago}  // 5 hours ago
{time;2021-11-05T04:01:43.661Z}          // 1636084903
{time format=relative_time;2022-08-21}   // in 10 months
```
shortDescription: Get the current time, format it or return it in unix milliseconds.

name: casing
longDescription:
Changes the casing of a string.

Accepted modes:
`lower` for lowercase
`upper` for uppercase
`first` to capitalise the first letter
`title` for "Title Case"
`camel` for camelCase
`constant` for CONSTANT\_CASE
shortDescription: Change the casing of a string

name: length
longDescription:
Returns the number of characters in a string and the number of elements in an array.

```pella
{length;pog}  // 3
{length;{[one;two;three]}}  // 3
```
shortDescription: Get the length of a string or array.

name: isSnowflake
longDescription:
Determines whether the target string is a snowflake.

#### Arguments

*   `lax`: Whether to accept snowflakes surrounded by characters or not.
*   `return_id`: Whether to return a boolean or an ID. If the target is not a snowflake and `return_id` is set to true, the tag outputs nothing.

```pella
{isSnowflake;111372124383428608}  // true
{isSnowflake;hello}               // false
{isSnowflake;123098123}           // false
{isSnowflake lax=true; hello 355876124779347968}             // true
{isSnowflake lax=true return_id=true;<@111372124383428608>}  // 111372124383428608
```
shortDescription: Determine whether the input string is a snowflake

name: snippet
longDescription:
Create a snippet of a string, truncating it if it is over the max length.

#### Arguments

*   `maxLength`: The maximum length of the snippet.
*   `suffix`: The suffix to add to the end of the snippet if it is truncated.
*   `extra`: The extra text to add to the end of the snippet, regardless of whether its truncated.
*   `target`: The string to create a snippet from.
shortDescription: Create a short snippet of a string

name: settings
longDescription:
Get a settings value from a plugin. This tag is intended mostly for internal use and as such there is no official list of all the settings keys available.

#### Arguments

*   `pluginCode`: The code of the plugin to get settings of, for example `suggestions`.
*   `settingsKey`: The settings key to get, for example `anonymousSuggestions` would check if the bot should make suggestions anonymous for the suggestions plugin.
shortDescription: Get the settings for a plugin

name: find
longDescription:
Finds `pattern` in `target` and returns the first match or all matches if specified. [Regular expressions](https://regexr.com/) are supported.

#### Arguments

*   `case_insensitive`: Whether the search should ignore case or not. Is incompatible with regex; use the flag `i` instead.
*   `return_all`: Whether to return an array of all matches or only the first one. Cannot be used without `/regex/g`.
*   `target`: The string to search.
*   `pattern`: The string or regex pattern to find.

```pella
{find;hello world;hello}     // hello
{find;hello world;nothing}
{find case_insensitive=false;hello world;HELLO}          // HELLO
{find;hello world;/hello/i}  // hello
{find return_all=true;hello hello hello world;/hello/ig} // {[hello;hello;hello]}
```
shortDescription: Find a value in a string.

name: replace
longDescription:
Replaces matches of `pattern` in `target` by `replacement`. [Regular expressions](https://regexr.com/) are supported.

#### Arguments

*   `case_insensitive`: Whether the search should ignore case or not. Is incompatible with regex; use the flag `i` instead.
*   `replace_all`: Whether to replace all matches or only the first one. Is incompatible with regex; use the flag `g` instead.
*   `target`: The string to search.
*   `pattern`: The string or regex pattern to find.
*   `replacement`: The string to put in place of the pattern.

```pella
{replace replace_all=false;hello hello;hell;hey}  // heyo hello
{replace;hello hello;hell;hey}     // heyo heyo
{replace;hello hello;/hell/;hey}   // heyo hello
{replace;hello hello;/hell/g;hey}  // heyo heyo
```
shortDescription: Find and replace a value in a string.

name: sleep
longDescription: Holds up processing. This does not schedule execution for later, it pauses execution until the sleep duration is up. You should only use this in very specific cases and avoid it entirely if possible.
shortDescription: Temporarily hold up processing. Tags before it will run normally, tags after it will have to wait.

name: math
longDescription:
Evaluates math. `precision_fix` enables a hack that fixes floating point precision errors, but may cause issues in very specific circumstances. Realistically nothing you do with actions should require disabling `precision_fix`.

Valid operators are `+`, `-`, `*`, `/`, `%`, `&`, `|`, and `^`
Valid functions are `sqrt`, `log`, `sin`, `cos`, `tan`, `sign`, `round`, `floor`, `ceil`, and `abs`
shortDescription: Evaluate math expressions

name: random
longDescription:
Gets a random item from a list. `length` is the number of items to return. When `length` is true, you can choose to return the random items in an array with `return_array`.

```pella
{random;123}           // 2
{random;{[1;2;3]}}     // 1
{random length=2;123}  // 21
{random length=2 return_array=true;123}  // {[2;1]}
```
shortDescription: Get a random item from the list.

name: fetch
longDescription:
Performs a HTTP request to a URL.

`application/json` will be parsed as JSON.
`application/xml`, `text/xml`, `application/rss+xml` and `application/atom+xml` will be parsed as XML.

    {=data;{fetch;https://atlas.bot/api/status}}\n{$data.body.ok}  // true
shortDescription: Fetch a URL and return the response data.

name: split
shortDescription: Split a string into an array of strings.

name: push
shortDescription: Add an item to an array

name: unshift
shortDescription: Add an item to the beginning of an array

name: shift
shortDescription: Get the first item in an array

name: pop
shortDescription: Get the last item in an array

name: or
longDescription:
Gets the first parameter that is not empty or falsy. The `boolean` option can be used to return a boolean instead of the first valid value.

```pella
{or;;two}       // "two"
{or;;}          // no output
{or;false;two}  // "two"
{or;one;two}    // "one", "two" is never evaluated
{or boolean;one;two}  // true
{or boolean;;}  // false
```
shortDescription: Check if any parameters are truthy

name: and
longDescription:
Ensures all parameters are present, returning the last parameter if all are valid. The `boolean` option can be used to return a boolean instead of the last parameter if all are valid.

```pella
{and;;two}     // no output, "two" is never evaluated
{and;one;two}  // "one", "two" is evaluated
{and;;}        // no output
{and boolean;one;two}  // true
{and boolean;one;}     // false
```
shortDescription: Check of all parameters are truthy

name: formatNumber
longDescription:
Formats a number. [Formats using the context locale if possible](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_separator) (for example, the guild language).

```pella
{formatNumber;1000.5} // 1,000.5
{formatNumber;1000.5} // 1 000,5 for some other languages
```
shortDescription: Format a number to the servers locale

name: if
shortDescription: Compare different values and do things based on the result.

name: for
shortDescription: Iterate over array items or loop however many times is necessary.

name: break
shortDescription: Break out of a loop early

name: throw
longDescription: Throws an engine error. Depending on your action setup, these will be shown to the user and logged just as regular engine errors would be.
shortDescription: Throw an error that stops processing unless it is handled by a {catch} tag.

name: catch
longDescription:
Catches a thrown error.

```pella
{catch;{throw;Test error};Oh no! Something went wrong}  // Oh no! Something went wrong
{catch;{throw;Oopsy poopsy!}}
{catch;{user.id}}  // 111372124383428608
```
shortDescription: Catch an engine error thrown by tags or a {throw} tag.

name: repeat
longDescription:
Repeats a string a given number of times.

```pella
{repeat;Hello;3} // HelloHelloHello
```
shortDescription: Repeat a string a certain number of times.

name: return
longDescription: Used to return early or to return rich data that may be butchered otherwise. Can be used in functions and the top-level scope. See more in the [returning](../scripts/returning.md) or [functions](../scripts/functions.md) sections.

name: void
longDescription:
Used to void the output of its children.

```pella
Hello {void;World} // "Hello "
```

name: keys
shortDescription: Get the keys of an object

name: join
longDescription:
Join the items of an array together with the given separator.

```pella
{=array;{[one;two;three]}}
{join;{$array};,} // one,two,three
```
shortDescription: Join an array into a string

name: randomInt
longDescription: Get a random number between `min` and `max`. If `max` is not specified, `min` is used as the maximum and `0` is used as the minimum.
shortDescription: Get a random integer between the given range.

name: isUrl
longDescription: Determine if `input` is a valid URL. This will not query the domain to see if it is registered, but it will check for a valid protocol and top-level domain.
shortDescription: Check if a string is a valid URL.

name: slice
shortDescription: Get a slice of an array or string

name: randomString
longDescription:
Generate a random string.

*   `length` is the length of the string to generate
*   `alphabet` is the alphabet to use. If not specified, it is `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789`
shortDescription: Generate a random string

name: includes
longDescription:
Check whether an array includes an item.

```pella
{=array;{[one;two;three]}}
{includes;{$array};two} // true
```
shortDescription: Check whether the target contains the value

name: import
longDescription:
Import a `script` action. View more information on the [imports](../scripts/imports.md) guide.

```pella
// In the script
[#function;my_function]
	Hello World!
[/function]
```

```pella
// In another action
{import;action/6c306503-adaf-48ae-b724-40b78d0edd28}
{my_function} // "Hello World!"
```
shortDescription: Import a script or action

name: sort
longDescription:
Sort an array. Returns a new array and does not mutate the original.

*   `array` the array to sort
*   `key` the key to sort by if the array is an array of objects.
shortDescription: Sort an array. Will not mutate the original array

name: index
longDescription:
Return the index at which a given element can be found in the array. Defaults to the first instance.

*   `mode?` an option mode for indexing the array. Can be `last` or `all`.
*   `array` the array to index
*   `value` the value to look for
shortDescription: Return the index at which a given element can be found in the array

name: filter
longDescription:
Return an array with just the elements that pass a check.

*   `array` the array to filter
*   `value` the value to filter by
*   `operator` the operator to filter by

The available operators are `==`, `===`, `!=`, `!==`, `>`, `>=`, `<`, `<=`, `startswith`, `endswith`, `contains`, `includes`, `has` and `matches`.
shortDescription: Return an array with just the elements that pass a check.

name: message.id
longDescription: Returns the ID of a message.
shortDescription: Get the ID of the message

name: message.content
longDescription: Returns a string with the content of a message.
shortDescription: Get the content of the message

name: message.delete
shortDescription: Delete the message

name: message.pinned
shortDescription: Check whether the message is pinned

name: message.pin
longDescription:
Pins a message.

#### Arguments

*   `{reason}`: The reason for the action that will be displayed in the Audit Log.
shortDescription: Pin the message

name: message.unpin
longDescription:
Unpins a message.

#### Arguments

*   `{reason}`: The reason for the action that will be displayed in the Audit Log.
shortDescription: Unpin the message

name: message.publish
longDescription: Publishes a message. Only works in news channels.
shortDescription: Publish a message in a news channel

name: message.embed
shortDescription: Get the embed of a message

name: message.referenceId
shortDescription: Get the ID of the message this message is referencing

name: message.addReaction
longDescription:
Adds a reaction to a message.

#### Arguments

*   `{emoji}`: The emoji to add as the reaction.
shortDescription: Add a reaction to the message

name: message.removeReaction
longDescription:
Removes a reaction from a message.

#### Arguments

*   `{emoji}`: The emoji to remove as the reaction.
shortDescription: Remove a reaction from the message

name: message.removeReactions
longDescription:
Removes all reactions, optionally for a specific emoji.

    {message.removeReactions}       // Will remove all reactions
    {message.removeReaction;emoji}  // Will remove all reactions for a specific emoji
shortDescription: Remove all reactions from the message, optionally for a specific emoji.

name: message.link
longDescription: Returns a string with the jump URL of a message.
shortDescription: Get the link to a message

name: message.authorId
longDescription: Returns the ID of the author of a message.
shortDescription: Get the ID of the author of the message

name: message.channelId
shortDescription: Get the ID of the channel the message was sent in

name: message.tts
longDescription: Checks if a message was sent as text to speech.

name: message.mentions
longDescription: Get a list of mentions from a message. Returns an array of IDs that includes roles, channels and users.
shortDescription: Get the mentions of a message

name: message.reactions
shortDescription: Returns an array of reactions for the message

name: message.attachments
longDescription:
Get the attachments from a message. Returns the first attachments url by default.

`single` is whether to return the first attachment or an array of attachments.
`objects` is whether to return the [attachment objects](https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#attachment-object-attachment-structure) or just their urls.
shortDescription: Get the attachments of a message

name: message.createdAt
longDescription: Returns a [timestamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date#description) for the creation date of a message that can be used with [{time}](https://documentation.atlas.bot/en/scripts/tags/global#time-formattime).
shortDescription: Get the time at which the message was created

name: suggestion.authorId
shortDescription: Get the author ID of the context suggestion

name: suggestion.content
shortDescription: Get the content of the context suggestion

name: suggestion.deniedReason
longDescription: Why the suggestion was denied. Takes the input from the text input component.
shortDescription: Get the denied reason of the context suggestion

name: suggestion.id
longDescription: The unique ID of the suggestion. Globably incremented.
shortDescription: Get the ID of the context suggestion

name: suggestion.messageLink
shortDescription: Get a link to the suggestion message

name: suggestion.createdAt
shortDescription: Get the creation date of the context suggestion

name: suggestion.messageId
longDescription:
The message for the current state of the Suggestion.

If the suggestion is waiting to be verified its the verification message. Once verified its the message in the suggestions channel. etc;
shortDescription: Get the message ID of the context suggestion

name: suggestion.updatedAt
shortDescription: Get the creation date of the context suggestion

name: suggestion.state
longDescription:
The state of the suggestion.

`Pending`
`Approved`
`Denied`
shortDescription: Get the state of the context suggestion

name: suggestion.keywords
shortDescription: Get a list of extracted keywords for the suggestion

name: suggestion.labels
shortDescription: Get the labels of the context suggestion

name: ticket.authorId
longDescription: Gets the ID of the ticket's author, if one is in context.
shortDescription: Get the tickets author id

name: ticket.channelId
longDescription: Gets the ID of the ticket's channel, if one is in context.
shortDescription: Get the tickets channel id

name: ticket.close
longDescription: Close the ticket channel.
shortDescription: Close a ticket

name: ticket.create
longDescription:
Open the ticket channel.

`reason` set the reason for the ticket.
`user` set the ticket author.
shortDescription: Create a new ticket

name: ticket.prefix
longDescription: Add a prefix to the beinging of the ticket channel's name. Leave `prefix` blank to return the current prefix.
shortDescription: Set or get a tickets prefix

name: ticket.reason
longDescription: Gets the reason of the ticket, if one is in context.
shortDescription: Get the reason a ticket was created

name: responder.text
longDescription:
Appends text to the output message. If there is more text, it will be appended to the existing text.

`{responder.text;Hello World}` will make the output message "Hello World"
`{responder.text;Hello}{responder.text;World}` will make the output message "Hello World"
`{responder.text;Hello}{responder.text;}` empty text will clear existing text.
shortDescription: Add text to the output message.

name: responder.dm
longDescription:
Set the responder to dm a user. This tag can be hit and miss if the user has their direct-messages closed.

`{responder.dm;{user.id}}` will make the message direct-message the user in context.
`{responder.dm fallback=true;{user.id}}` will send a message to the user and will fall back to the context channel if the user has their direct-mesage closed.
shortDescription: Configure the output message to go to a specific user

name: responder.embed
longDescription:
This tag is used to add embeds to the message. Calling it multiple times will add multiple embeds to the message, up to a maximum of 10. `{responder.embed title="Hello world"}` `{responder.embed title=Test timestamp="5 hours ago"}` Embed Elements `author-image` `author-name` `author-url` `color` `description` `footer` `footer-icon` `image` `thumbnail` `timestamp` `title` `url` Use the [Embed Builder](https://staging.atlas.bot/tools/embed-builder) to quickly build an embed.
Color Defaults

Black: #000000 Dark Mode: #36393f White: #FFFFFF Red: #ED4245 Pink: #EB459E Fuchsia: #EB459E Purple: #9C27B0 Blurple: #5865F2 Blurple Classic: #7289DA Deep Purple: #673AB7 Indigo: #3F51B5 Blue: #2196F3 Light Blue: #03A9F4 Cyan: #00BCD4 Teal: #009688 Green: #57F287 Light Green: #8BC34A Lime: #CDDC39 Yellow: #FEE75C Amber: #FFC107 Orange: #FF9800 Deep Orange: #FF5722 Brown: #795548 Grey: #9E9E9E Blue Grey: #607D8B Role Default: #4f545c Magenta: #E91E63
shortDescription: Attach an embed to the output message.

name: responder.embedField
shortDescription: Add a field to an embed

name: responder.channel
shortDescription: Configure the output channel for the responder content

name: responder.reset
shortDescription: Reset the responder settings to its initial state

name: responder.ephemeral
shortDescription: Interaction-only; Whether the output message should be only viewable by the user who created the interaction.

name: responder.error
shortDescription: The same as {responder.text} except it does some error-related things, like making embeds red and making the message ephemeral. You should use this whenever sending an error message.

name: responder.send
longDescription:
Send the message immediately. This will automatically call `{responder.reset}` if the message is sent successfully.

`return_id` can be used to get the output message ID. **return\_id does not work when replying to an interaction**. Discord does not give us message data when we send an interaction, however because the responder will assume you mean the context interaction, leaving out the ID should do effectively the same thing.

`ignore_interaction` can be set to have the responder ignore the context interaction and reply with a regular message in the context channel. **The interaction still needs a reply or it will be marked as failed**, you should only use this to send off a separate message.

If the responder is configured when the script finishes, it will be sent automatically. This means you probably don't need `{responder.send}` unless you're sending multiple messages.
shortDescription: Send the configured responder message

name: responder.edit
longDescription:
Set the responder to edit the given message. Atlas must have sent the message to edit it.
Place after the new message content.
shortDescription: Edit a message with the configured responder message

name: responder.button
signature: {responder.button label handler? stateless? state? url? emoji? style=primary actionRowIndex? disabled=false}
longDescription:
Add a button to the message.

#### Arguments

*   `label` is the button text.
*   `handler` is the value of the component callback action to call when the button is clicked
*   `state` is an optional payload that will be accessible in the component callback action
*   `url` can be used to link to external resources
*   `emoji` is the name of an emoji to add to the button. Can be a guild emoji or a native emoji.
*   `stateless` Whether this button should be forced to be a stateless interaction. Required if you don't want the button to expire.
*   `style` can change the [button style](https://discord.com/developers/docs/interactions/message-components#button-object-button-styles), which defaults to `Primary`. This will be ignored if `url` is present.
*   `disabled` can be set to `true` to disable the button.
*   `actionRowIndex` can be used to set the row the button is in. This is useful if you want to have multiple buttons in a row.

If you want a button to only have an emoji, here is a fun hack. Copy this empty space and paste it into the button label.

    ‚Äé
shortDescription: Add a button to the message

name: responder.select
signature: {responder.select handler stateless=false state? disabled=false placeholder? minValues? maxValues? actionRowIndex? type=StringSelect;options}
shortDescription: Add a select menu to the message

name: responder.reference
longDescription: Set the responder to reference the given message. Call with no params, `{responder.reference}`, to stop the bot replying to the context message.
shortDescription: Reference a message or remove the existing reference

name: role.id
shortDescription: Get the id of the given role.

name: role.name
shortDescription: Get the name of the given role.

name: role.mention
longDescription:
Returns the role @mention.

`allow_mention` is whether to ping the role.
shortDescription: Get the @mention of the given role.

name: role.position
shortDescription: Get the position of the given role.

name: role.colour
shortDescription: Get the color of the given role.

name: role.managed
longDescription: Returns `true` for managed roles. ex: Server Boost and Bot roles.
shortDescription: Get whether the given role is managed.

name: role.mentionable
longDescription: Returns a boolean indicating whether the role can be mentioned.
shortDescription: Get whether the given role is mentionable.

name: role.createdAt
shortDescription: Get the created at date of the given role.

name: role.hasPermission
longDescription:
Check whether the role has the specified permission.

`{role.hasPermission;administrator}`
shortDescription: Check whether the role has the given permission

name: role.hoisted
longDescription: Returns a boolean indicating whether the role is hoisted above other roles in the member list.
shortDescription: Get whether the given role is hoisted.

name: role.edit
longDescription:
Edit the role. `name` is the new role name `color` is the new colour of the role `reason` is the reason for editing this role {role.edit name="Very cool" colour=teal}
Color Defaults

Black: #000000 Dark Mode: #36393f White: #FFFFFF Red: #ED4245 Pink: #EB459E Fuchsia: #EB459E Purple: #9C27B0 Blurple: #5865F2 Blurple Classic: #7289DA Deep Purple: #673AB7 Indigo: #3F51B5 Blue: #2196F3 Light Blue: #03A9F4 Cyan: #00BCD4 Teal: #009688 Green: #57F287 Light Green: #8BC34A Lime: #CDDC39 Yellow: #FEE75C Amber: #FFC107 Orange: #FF9800 Deep Orange: #FF5722 Brown: #795548 Grey: #9E9E9E Blue Grey: #607D8B Role Default: #4f545c Magenta: #E91E63
shortDescription: Edit a roles settings

name: role.create
longDescription:
Create a new role. `name` is the name of the role `color` is the colour of the role `reason` is the reason for creating the role `return_id` is whether to return the created roles ID.
Color Defaults

Black: #000000 Dark Mode: #36393f White: #FFFFFF Red: #ED4245 Pink: #EB459E Fuchsia: #EB459E Purple: #9C27B0 Blurple: #5865F2 Blurple Classic: #7289DA Deep Purple: #673AB7 Indigo: #3F51B5 Blue: #2196F3 Light Blue: #03A9F4 Cyan: #00BCD4 Teal: #009688 Green: #57F287 Light Green: #8BC34A Lime: #CDDC39 Yellow: #FEE75C Amber: #FFC107 Orange: #FF9800 Deep Orange: #FF5722 Brown: #795548 Grey: #9E9E9E Blue Grey: #607D8B Role Default: #4f545c Magenta: #E91E63
shortDescription: Create a guild role

name: role.delete
shortDescription: Delete a role

name: server.id
shortDescription: Get the id of the context server

name: server.name
shortDescription: Get the name of the context server

name: server.icon
longDescription:
Gets the icon of the server.

#### Arguments

*   `size`: The size of the image to get. Must be a valid [CDN size](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#image-formatting).
*   `hash`: Whether to return the hash directly instead of a URL.
shortDescription: Get the icon of the context server

name: server.splash
longDescription:
Gets the splash image of the server.

#### Arguments

*   `size`: The size of the splash to get. Must be a valid [CDN size](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#image-formatting).
*   `hash`: Whether to return the hash directly instead of a URL.
shortDescription: Get the splash image of the context server

name: server.banner
longDescription:
Gets the banner of the server.

#### Arguments

*   `size`: The size of the banner to get. Must be a valid [CDN size](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#image-formatting).
*   `hash`: Whether to return the hash directly instead of a URL.

name: server.channels
shortDescription: Get a list of all the channels in the server as a list of ids.

name: server.roles
shortDescription: Get a list of all the roles in the server as a list of ids.

name: server.shardId
longDescription: Returns the ID of the shard the bot is running on in the server.
shortDescription: Get the id of the shard the server is on

name: server.ownerId
shortDescription: Get the id of the owner of the context server

name: server.memberCount
longDescription: Returns the total count of members in the server. This should be almost exactly accurate and is not subject to caching issues.
shortDescription: Get how many members are currently in the server

name: server.createdAt
longDescription: Returns a [timestamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date#description) for the creation date of a server that can be used with [{time}](https://documentation.atlas.bot/en/scripts/tags/global#time-formattime).
shortDescription: Get the time the server was created as a unix millisecond timestamp.

name: server.prefix
longDescription: Gets the legacy prefix of the server. This tag is only available for compatibility reasons and is not recommended in new actions. This tag is deprecated and may be removed in a future release.
shortDescription: Get the prefix of the server

name: server.subscriptionTier
longDescription:
Returns the subscription tier level of the server.

`0 = Prime`, `1 = PrimeClassic`, `2 = PrimeCommunity`
shortDescription: Get the subscription level of the server

name: server.subscriptionUser
longDescription: Returns the ID of the user who added the subscription to the server.
shortDescription: Get the user who added the subscription of the server

name: store.set
longDescription: Adds an item to the store. `value` can be an object, array, string, number, etc. `key` will be coerced to a string.
shortDescription: Store a persistent value by a key

name: store.get
shortDescription: Get a persistent value by a key

name: store.delete
shortDescription: Delete a persistent value by a key

name: user.mention
longDescription: Returns a string with a user mention.
shortDescription: Get the @mention for the user.

name: user.id
longDescription: Returns the ID of a user.
shortDescription: Get the users id

name: user.username
longDescription: Returns the username of a user.
shortDescription: Get the users username

name: user.bot
longDescription: Returns a boolean whether a user is a bot account.
shortDescription: Check whether this user is a bot

name: user.tag
longDescription: Returns the tag of a user with the username and discriminator, for example `DracoClaw#0065`.
shortDescription: Get the username#discriminator combination for the user.

name: user.discriminator
longDescription: Returns the discriminator of a user, which is the four digits at the end of the username.
shortDescription: Get the users discriminator.

name: user.avatar
longDescription: Returns the avatar URL of a user. Their server avatar will take priority if they have one.
shortDescription: Get the users avatar url.

name: user.roles
longDescription:
Returns an array of IDs for all the roles of a user.

    {choose;{user.roles}}  // A random role the user has
shortDescription: Get an array of ids corresponding to roles the user has.

name: user.nickname
longDescription: Returns the display name of a user. This will be their nickname if they have one set and their username otherwise.
shortDescription: Get the users nickname. Returns the users username if they have no nickname.

name: user.joinedAt
longDescription: Returns a [timestamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date#description) for the join date of a user that can be used with [{time}](https://documentation.atlas.bot/en/scripts/tags/global#time-formattime).
shortDescription: Get the time the user joined the server at.

name: user.createdAt
longDescription: Returns a [timestamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date#description) for the creation date of a user's Discord account that can be used with [{time}](https://documentation.atlas.bot/en/scripts/tags/global#time-formattime).
shortDescription: Get the time the user created their account.

name: user.edit
longDescription:
Edits a user.

#### Arguments

*   `nick`: The user's new nickname. Leave empty to clear.
*   `mute`: Whether the user will be server muted in voice channels.
*   `deaf`: Whether the user will be server deafened in voice channels.
*   `channel`: The new channel to move the user to if they are in voice channel.
shortDescription: Edit the state or options for a user.

name: user.addRole
longDescription:
Gives a user a role.

#### Arguments

*   `reason`: The reason for the action that will be displayed in the Audit Log.
*   `role`: The role to add to the user.
shortDescription: Give the user a role

name: user.removeRole
longDescription:
Removes a role from a user.

#### Arguments

*   `reason`: The reason for the action that will be displayed in the Audit Log.
*   `role`: The role to remove from the user.
shortDescription: Take a role from a user

name: user.colour
longDescription: Gets a user's colour based on their highest non-default (#99aab5) role.
shortDescription: Get the colour of the user based on their highest role

name: user.hasPermission
longDescription:
Checks whether a user has the given permissions.

*   `permissions` can be a permissions number or name, for example `create_instant_invite`. A full list of permissions can be seen [here](https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/permissions#permissions-bitwise-permission-flags).
*   `member` the member to check the permissions of. Defaults to the context user.
shortDescription: Check if the user has a permission

name: user.level
longDescription:
Gets the level of a user.

*   `user` the user to get the level of. Defaults to the context user.
shortDescription: Get the users level

name: user.xp
longDescription:
*   `user` the user to get the XP of. Defaults to the context user.
*   `scoped` whether to get XP on the current level or total XP, defaults to total XP.
shortDescription: Get the users xp amount

name: user.setXP
longDescription:
Sets the users XP to the given amount.

*   `xp` the amount of XP to set.
*   `target` the user to set the XP of. Defaults to the context user.
*   `add` whether to add the XP to their existing total.
*   `sync` whether to sync level rewards for the user.
shortDescription: Set the users XP amount

name: user.setLevel
longDescription:
Sets the users level to the given amount.

*   `level` the amount of levels to set.
*   `target` the user to set the level of. Defaults to the context user.
*   `add` whether to add the levels to their existing total.
*   `sync` whether to sync level rewards for the user.
shortDescription: Set the users level

name: user.nextLevel
shortDescription: Get the next level the user will achieve

name: user.nextLevelXP
shortDescription: Get the xp required for the user's next level

name: user.remainingXP
longDescription: Gets the amount of XP a user needs to level up to the next level.
shortDescription: Get the amount of xp the user needs to level up

name: user.rank
shortDescription: Get the rank of the user

name: user.reward
longDescription:
Returns the reward the user achieved by levelling up. Returns nothing if there was no reward. **This tag is only available in level-up scripts** and cannot be used elsewhere.

`first` is whether to return only the first reward in the filtered list. Some levels can have multiple rewards, so this might be useful for displaying all of them. An empty array will be returned if there are no rewards and `first=false`

`raw` is whether to return a raw rewards object with more information about the reward. The object looks something like `{ level, roleId, stack }`

`filter` is the kind of reward to return. The default, `achieved`, is recommended if you just want to tell the user of new roles they got by levelling up.

*   `achieved`: Filters to roles the user achieved by levelling up.
*   `entitled`: Filters to all roles the user is entitled to.
*   `added`: Filters to roles that were added to the user by levelling up. If the user levels up to level 10 and that level has a reward but the user already has that reward, it would not be included in this filter. `achieved` on the other hand would have included it.
*   `removed`: Filters to rewards that were removed by levelling up.
*   `existing`: Filters to rewards that the user had before levelling up.

As an example, you could set your level-up notification to this

    {if;{user.reward};Congratulations {user.mention}! You levelled up to level {user.level} and got the {role.mention allow_mention=false;{user.reward}} role!}

Which would send a level-up message only if the user got a new role.
shortDescription: Get the list of the rewards the user is entitled to, were added, were removed or already had. Only available in level-up messages.
